What can you expect? Relax. It's Easy. Whether you are looking for a practical method to handle stress, a life too full of priorities, or for insights into the meaning of life, into spiritual growth, this will help. 

Sahaja Yoga Meditation is unique in ways too numerous to explain here. Unlike other forms of meditation or yoga, this is not something you "do" - it is more about a state of becoming, of "being" rather than doing, a living process that transforms your life from within.

Classes are:

led by experts, with thousands of hours of practical experience, deep knowledge and skill. In addition, there are often people training to become instructors who are happy to offer individual guidance. 

tailored to the needs of the attendees. A starter session will be given if there are newcomers. New techniques and insights are always available for regulars. Advanced techniques will also be explored.

no more than an hour. Not long, considering the benefits can last a lifetime. They begin with a brief introduction followed by 30-40 minutes of instruction, and meditation practice.

What Sahaja Meditation Can Do For You

Sahaja Meditation is good for heart, mind, body and soul. It's all about energy — Kundalini Energy — and everyone has it. Sahaja Meditation is a simple technique that lets you tap into that energy and harness its power to become better balanced and better connected to yourself — emotionally, physically, and spiritually. It's easy. Anyone can do it.  

Here are just a few specific benefits Sahaja Meditation offers…  
• Immediate stress relief and long-term stress management  
• Improve physical and emotional health and boost long-term resilience  
• Improve overall personality and relationships  
• Balance personal and professional responsibilities  
• Take control of your life; control negative emotions such as anger, fear, anxiety, guilt  
• Improve cognitive functioning: focus, clarity, decision-making and problem-solving skills, enhanced creativity  

What is Sahaja Meditation?  

How does Sahaja Meditation differ from other popular forms of meditation? On the surface, Sahaja Meditation has a lot in common with other forms of meditation. But what's unique to Sahaja is the ability to awaken and connect to your Kundalini Energy and influence the movement of this energy up through your body's seven primary energy centers known as chakras, to achieve physical and emotional well-being and ultimately establish a spiritual connection.  

How does energy flow work? It flows through each of your energy centers or chakras, energizing, nurturing and balancing them. Think of your Inner Energy system as a flute with seven holes — each hole representing a chakra, and your inner energy representing the air that is blown through the flute. If the flute's holes are unobstructed, the flute can produce melodious, harmonious music in the hands of a skilled musician. And so it is with your chakras. When they're clear and free of obstructions, your inner energy flows through your body smoothly, achieving a harmonious balance.  

Once awakened, you'll find that Sahaja Meditation makes it easy to meditation effortlessly. Most forms of meditation don't allow you to easily actualize the energy on Day 1. The reason is that Sahaja Meditation has the unique ability to achieve the powerful state of thoughtless awareness, quickly and effortlessly. What is thoughtless awareness? Think of it as purified attention, a state of maximum energy flow during which your mind is calmed and gradually emptied of all distractions and negative thoughts and feelings. Sahaja Meditation techniques allow you to extend that fraction-of-a-second gap between one thought and the next to remain in a thoughtless state for as long as you wish. Thoughtless awareness is a much-needed break from the thoughts that constantly bombard us all day long.  

Overview.

The primary focus of Sahaja Meditation classes, especially for beginners, is awakening and experiencing the energy with the goal of achieving thoughtless awareness. We'll provide a brief overview of the subtle energy system so that you can understand the sensations you feel within your body and correlate your experience to real physical and mental attributes. But experience is always valued over knowledge. In other words, the proof of the pudding is in the eating, not in learning how to make elaborate pudding recipes or discussing how wonderful the pudding tastes.  

If you continue to practice Sahaja Meditation, you'll discover and experience, step by step, your own energy centers and their associated qualities. Once you're able to consistently feel the energy and have experienced noticeable differences in your cognitive and emotional states, you can explore more advanced techniques, such as clearing and healing the chakras. You'll learn how the energy centers play a vital role in our evolutionary process of becoming better human beings and experience holistic improvement on all planes — physical, cognitive, emotional and spiritual. In the ultimate and most advanced phases, you may choose to use Sahaja Meditation to discover your inner spiritual self and how you can evolve to higher realms of spirituality. For many, Sahaja is much more than just a temporary solution or quick relief. It is a journey, rather than a destination.  

Ultimately, Sahaja classes can provide a complete course on meditation and spirituality, which you can continue to experiment with and verify at every step. Just as no two life experiences are exactly alike, no two Sahaja Meditation experiences are exactly alike. You can explore at your own pace, in your own way. There are no rules, restrictions or rituals. Sahaja is entirely Do-It-Yourself. And we are always available to help.  

There's no pressure to continue attending classes. You can come once or twice and never come back again or you can attend classes weekly. Many find that attending classes weekly is just what they need to recharge their batteries.  

The power of collective meditation. 

Collective meditation in an optimized environment can be exhilarating and rejuvenating. In fact, generally, the larger the group, the better the experience. Collective meditation is also likely to help you progress faster in the initial weeks, as compared to meditating at home, alone.
results.name: Sahaja Yoga Meditation Union City NJ

topics.name: Sign Language for Hearing Babies and Toddlers

results.description: This is a group for Hudson County parents interested in bonding with their babies 6-18 months through American Sign Language (ASL). Baby Sign Language lets babies, as young as six months old communicate their needs so they don't need to cry as often. Your baby will learn how to tell you when she is hungry, wants more, or is all done; if he is too cold or too hot, or if she just needs a hug. Studies reveal that babies who sign begin speaking earlier and have a larger vocabulary than their non-signing peers. I started this group because I wanted to empower my baby girl to express herself through signing and because I could find no classes in our local area. Packing baby up to take her into the City or into Bergen County was not something that I wanted to do on a regular basis. Instead, I've created a network of instructors who will travel to us to provide classes. Classes are fun and interactive as babies and their parents learn signing through song and music. We will meet at local (Hudson County) libraries and community centers.
results.name: Hudson County Baby Signers

results.description: Welcome! You are reading about this group for a reason! Are you on the threshold of a major change? Are you in the midst of a significant transition or just past a seismic event in your life that has shifted everything? Now you may be wondering how you are going survive and thrive! This group for anyone interested in cooking up their own "recipe for reinvention" and actively creating a life that matches your inner desires. Reinvention is a chance to examine and discover what your dream life/job/career is, what your resources are and creatively design who you want to be going forward. Transforming your life from married to single, from employed to entrepreneur, unwell to wellness can be a daunting journey and the support of like-mined individuals who understand and have compassion for what you are facing can make all the difference in reaching your goals. In this group we will engage in exercises led by the group organizer that create real discoveries and action plans, as well as share experiences in a compassionate, safe environment.
results.name: Recipe for Reinvention: Cook Up A Better Future Now!

results.description: Trinity Grace Church East Village is starting a 4 week book study on Mere Christianity by C.S. Lewis. The thought behind the book study is that we have a healthy discussion. The hope is that the discussion won't be a debate, but more of a safe space for people to say their point of view and raise questions. We will talk about big life questions, such as: "how do we define our moral laws?", "how can God be good if He allows suffering or how can we say that God exists because there is suffering?" and other topics. ***You do not have to have read the whole book to come. We will focus on a couple pages/topic per week, and there will be printouts available. However, if you fill out the form below, you will receive the reading/topic over email before each Monday.*** |When: Mondays (Feb 29, March 7, March 14, and March 21) |Time: 7-8:30pm |Where: First Ukrainian Assembly of God New York City (59 Cooper Sq, New York, NY 10003) |*Wine and cheese will be provided each week! |Form to fill out: http://bit.do/merechristianitystudy

results.description:
“Life is nothing without a little chaos to make it interesting.”
 ― Amelia Atwater-Rhodes, Demon in My View


C.H.A.O.S. is Climbing, Hiking, Adventures and Outdoors for Singles

GROUP OBJECTIVES: This group is a social forum to bring together active singles who enjoy Climbing (be it indoor or outdoor or ice), leisurely social hiking, being outdoors and partaking in a multitude of adventures year-round.

PLEASE NOTE WE ARE NOT A DATING SITE. Our main focus is for adventurous singles to meet and connect with fellow singles and like-minded adventurers to have fun together and perhaps becoming friends in the process without the pressure of dating.

If you are looking for a dating site this is not it, please look elsewhere. Please respect your fellow members. Any inappropriate behavior will not be tolerated and person with the inappropriate behavior will be kicked out of the group.

ABOUT OUR CLIMBING EVENTS: Rock climbing provides a full-body workout that tests the mind as much as it does the body -- and also happens to be a lot of FUN and ADDICTIVE. There are more opportunities to do it than ever before, too, with several indoor facilities that cater to the vertical workout popping up throughout the city over the past five years. We will do climbs at Brooklyn Boulders in Queens and Brooklyn, as well as at The Cliffs in LIC. No worries if you are new to rock climbing. It's very easy to learn as long as you are open to adventures. We will practice and learn together on our way to becoming ROCK STARS.

In addition to indoor climbing, we will on occasions do outdoor rock climbing as well as ice climbing up in the Shawangunk or the Catskills regions.

ABOUT OUR HIKES: We subscribe to the premise that hiking should be a fun, leisurely experience. It’s NOT about how fast you can hike. There is no pot of gold at the end of the rainbow to chase after. Hiking is about taking the time to savor the sights and sounds of nature. It’s about enjoying each other’s company, get to know each other, while on the trails and perhaps even hug some trees along the trails. We will keep at a leisurely pace on our hikes, with plenty of stops for catching our breaths, having refreshments, and taking in all the Kodak moments. Everyone will go at their own pace, with no fear of being left behind.

PLEASE, NO SPEED DEMONS. If you want to go fast, there are plenty of other hiking groups on Meetup that can accommodate your need for speed. All our hikes will be on weekends within the NY/NJ area, many of which hikes will be serviced by public transportation. Occasionally we’ll do hikes where we’d have to carpool to get there.

ABOUT OTHER ADVENTURES WE WILL PARTAKE IN: Ziplining, skiing, kayaking, whitewater rafting, travelling to places near and far, wine tasting, skydiving … or even just plain eating out, enjoying a meal together … the possibilities are ENDLESS.

WHO SHOULD JOIN THIS GROUP: Singles of all ages who like to hike at leisurely pace, rock climbers of all skill levels and/or just anyone with a sense of adventure and a positive attitude and a willingness to learn and try new things. Please leave the drama and crankiness at home.

MEETUP FEE: It is FREE to join a Meetup group. However, each group’s Organizer does pay a fee to Meetup HQ to keep the site up and running. Meetup Organizers have the option to charge a minimal fee to help defray the monthly Meetup cost. Therefore, a $1.00 Meetup fee will be collected at randomly selected events. Our organizers DO NOT make any profit from running this group.

IMPORTANT GROUP RULES: A successful group is not about how many members there are in the group. It is about the quality of members in the group! We would rather have a small group of "quality members" than a huge group of "joiners" and “lurkers” who never show up to any event.

With that said:

(1) To join the group, you must have a recognizable face picture;

(2) Being a member in the group, you don’t have to attend every event on the calendar, but try to participate in at least 1 event every few months. If you are a general lurker who join the group but not participate in any event, please don’t bother to join.

General rsvp policy:

Yes rsvps ONLY if you are serious about attending an event. No need to rsvp if not attending.

We will enforce a strict ANTI-FLAKE POLICY - Just one (1) no-show or last minute (less than 24 hours) cancel will get you booted out of the group.

If you are an RSVP-aholic, that is, you rsvp to every single event and then bail out last minute, you do not belong in this group.
results.name: Climbing, Hiking, Adventures & Outdoors for Singles (CHAOS)

results.description:
Closing Deals in Six-Inch Heels Closing Deals in Six-Inch Heels is a group for success-minded business women balancing the work-life dichotomy. Our goal is to provide a space for professional women from a diverse range of disciplines can relax unwind and network with peers in a collaborative and rewarding environment.

While the group is mainly geared towards women, we aren't in this alone; men make up the other half of the equation and as such, men who support women's empowerment are critical allies and are welcome to bring a fresh perspective from a male p.o.v. to the group. A sample of the important areas of focus for the group include the following:

Business Ideas and Strategies to Maximize Success.

Whether you've got it all figured out and want to share, or are struggling along, this group formulates ideas and strategies to move you to the next level your career.

Interpersonal Relationships and Communication

Balancing work and relationships is a challenge every successful business woman must master. Here women share their experiences and strategies for having a rewarding personal life outside of the boardroom.

Women's Leadership and Political Representation

Representation in the business and political worlds is key to the successful integration of women into the decision-making fabric of our society. Business women explore the means for effective representation in an ever changing world.

Children and Career

So, we've met all the deadlines, closed the latest deal, or negotiated a jaw-dropping settlement in a lawsuit. What now? This group effectively explores and provides solutions to effectively manage our maternal instincts, with work life.

Overcoming Fear of Failure

"Courage allows the successful woman to fail and learn powerful lessons, from the failure. So that in the end, she didn't fail at all." -Maya Angelou

Studies show [1], a major inhibitor of success among women, much more so than men, is fear of failure. But why fear failure, when you can mine it for gems that will help you to become even more successful than you would have been without this bump in the road? This group examines the rules of engagement when facing failures. We discuss these teaching moments as phenomenal launching pads to coming back stronger and more successful than ever.

Beyond our member-driven seminars and workshops, we also take time to bond and enjoy the wider world. Whether dressing up and having a night on the town or planning an adventurous excursion, anything can happen when women put their minds to it. Come join us and make friendships which will last a lifetime.

[1] Clifford, Catherine. "Lack of Confidence, Fear of Failure Hold Women Back From Being Entrepreneurs." Lack of Confidence, Fear of Failure Hold Women Back From Being Entrepreneurs. Entrepreneur, 31 July 2013. Web. 25 Feb. 2016.

organizer.name: Closing Deals in Six Inch Heels

results.description: "Mix To Go Massive" (NYC) was launched in spring 2008. It was part of a publication known then (and to this day) as "Mix To Go Magazine." "Massive" was created to promote the coming together of New Yorkers for parties, social events, travel-oriented events related to music (like a ski weekend, Caribbean cruise or music festival) and the like. The group grew quickly from just a NYC chapter to chapters in Miami, Vegas and Atlanta...then just as quickly its founder "got busy living" and shut down the meetups. But "Mix To Go Massive" kept going and growing; it is still a very active Facebook group of over 5,000 members (www.facebook.com/groups/mixtogo). The return of "Mix To Go Massive" to Meetup is to create a NEW atmosphere of fun and excitement for people who like to go out and dance, socialize and hear good music. Most genres are represented musically but the four most requested are top 40/open format (a little of everything popular in a great DJ mix), EDM Parties (think Pacha and Webster Hall...MINUS those venues; no disrespect if you like them!!), house music (there are a few splits genre-wise...especially during the summer when endless outdoor parties take place)...and Caribbean events (especially if you hang out in Brooklyn). "Mix To Go Massive" founder Freedom hosts seven (7) events weekly with additional "one-offs" such as yacht parties, 1 day cruises and holiday events...and in 2017 there will be a seasonal travel-oriented event. Join the movement IF you plan to be an active member (this is one of the reasons the groups were disbanded before). Bring friends, make suggestions and attend our weekly "town hall meetings" where we discuss the "business of having fun" in New York City: Suggestions are made by members, ideas are presented to the group and "secret" events and VIP-only events are announced to the most active members. results.description:
Welcome to The Social Bucketeers! A Bucket List Group For Social New Yorkers!

One of the items on my Bucket List was to create a Bucket List Meetup Group.  I’ve been an Organizer for a meetup group before and wished I had made it a Bucket List meetup group. Hence the Bucketeers! 

This group was created to help you fulfill items on your Bucket List while meeting and interacting with some really cool people!!  There are people that might be important in your life, that you haven't even met yet.   It's very likely, this is the place where you will meet them.  We all have things we want to do or try, but no one wants to do these things alone. Join this group and create your list. We will then do our best to match you up with people to share these accomplishments with.

Your life is YOUR choice. YOU get to decide. We all have abilities we can do and abilities we don’t know how to do. Ask yourself... Do you want to go through life using your "inexperience" as an excuse not to do them or the reason why you should? At the risk of sounding morbid, when it’s my time to go I want to be sliding into home base with dirt flying all over the place! I don’t want to say I was too careful/scared to try something. The question is…. What do YOU want to be able to say?

It's YOUR choice.. Do you want your life to be an excuse to not live it or do you want it to be the reason to experience your life to its fullest?

The concept of this meetup group is simple... It's all about YOU, YOUR life, YOUR dreams and YOUR accomplishments!!! Please suggest meetups for things you want to do/try. Please RSVP for existing events that you want to do/try. If you have ideas or suggestions for events, Please post a comment. If you want to host the event, contact me and I'll make you an assistant organizer. 

I can tell you by personal experience that checking something off your bucket list is great, but riding shotgun on someone else’s dream is even better!!!! You will be the person that someone will always remember because you will be the person that helps them complete a full circle in their life. And isn’t that what it’s all about?!?

I look forward to meeting you and checking things off our lists together!

La-Verne a.k.a. Dash or LaDash, Organizer.
results.name: THE SOCIAL BUCKETEERS!!

results.description:
Welcome to SOMA Families!

We are a welcoming and inclusive community of moms, dads, and caregivers from South Orange and Maplewood (and bordering towns which include East Orange, Irvington, Millburn, Newark, Orange, Short Hills, Union and West Orange). We embrace all types of families and value diversity.  Whether you are a stay-at-home or working parent, SOMA Families offers social events and supportive groups for you, your family, and your caregiver.  Most of our events occur in South Orange and Maplewood (aka SOMA!). We like to get together for playdates, outings of all types, adult-only events, social services, book clubs, family events and just about anything else.

In addition to hosting events, we also provide a community calendar of all the events going on in our community. We’re pretty lucky to live in a place that has so much to offer to families and we want to help you keep track of all the fun activities in one spot (this is a separate file listed under "More").

We are excited to have you join our group. We are an *active* group and expect our members to be active participants. We are relying on everyone’s support as the more active our members are, the more we all gain. This is why we ask each member to attend at least two events and organize one Meetup per year. While we do not limit our membership, our focus is on the quality of our membership, not the quantity. If members are not active, they may be removed from the group. 

Once you're a member, you can schedule a meetup by filling out the SOMA Families Event Request Form. You can find it under "Pages". 

Before you join, please read through our guidelines and terms of service. Once you have read through those sections, fill out the provided questionnaire completely. This is vital! Think of your Meetup profile as you would your Facebook profile. SOMA Families is a social network where we need to know and recognize each other. This is why we require a picture and a completed questionnaire from all of our members (NOTE: This is only visible to other members as we are a private group).  

Thank you for your interest. We look forward to meeting you and your family soon!
results.name: SOMA Families Meetup

results.description:
The Yoga Womb offers pregnant and parenting moms a safe and nurturing place to explore yoga and to deepen the connection with themselves, with community and with their baby. The Yoga Womb is a Yoga Alliance Registered Yoga School with RPYT teachers.

Why Practice Yoga?
The practice of yoga in pregnancy and parenthood encourages women to embrace their innate wisdom enabling empowered parenthood from the womb to the wonder years.
Yoga helps parents and children openly explore the mind, body, and spirit. Using a three-pronged approach good classes help women to increase their sense of well-being, while addressing the common aches and sensations of pregnancy and the postnatal body so students feel better each day; foster a compassionate community of friendship and support; and integrate childbirth education and parenting skills into classes to help the mother be more prepared and empowered for labor, delivery and motherhood.
Most healthcare professionals fully support women practicing yoga during pregnancy and beyond because they realize the countless benefits it has for the mamas-to-be and how it aids in a successful and safe birthing experience. Pre/Postnatal classes are appropriate and safe for all stages of pregnancy and practice and is a beautiful place for a beginner to commence their parenting and yoga journey.
The most important thing to keep in mind is that anything that turns our attention to ourselves is going to be healing for the body and really good for the baby
Classes include:
•  The ABC’s x 2: Awareness and Acceptance, Breath and Balance, and Connection and Concentration
•  Postures & sequences for each trimester of pregnancy, along with contraindications
•  Pregnancy and postnatal A&P
•  Postures that heal common discomforts
•  Emotional changes of birth and parenting
•  Fostering a deeper parent-child bond
•  Meditations and chants
•  Pelvic floor strengthening
•  Childbirth preparation

Benefits of Prenatal Yoga:
•  Prepares mom for labor and delivery
•  Strengthen connection with self and baby
•  Reduce stress and anxiety
•  Enhance mood and decrease depression
•  Improve sleep
•  Stay in shape and increase the strength, flexibility and endurance of muscles needed for childbirth
•  Decrease lower back pain, sciatica, nausea, carpal tunnel syndrome, headaches, shortness of breath and more
•  Decrease the risk of preterm labor, pregnancy-induced hypertension and intrauterine growth restriction — a condition that slows baby's growth
•  Helps attune mom to her body and her needs
Benefits of Postnatal/Baby and Me Yoga:
•  Gives focused time to bond and spend quality time together without distractions
•  Time to meet other parents, discuss childcare issues, swap tips and feel supported by peers
•  Enjoy poses to stretch and calm baby with playfully interactive postures
•  Yoga encourages baby’s natural development, aid digestion, strengthen their body while bringing balance and peace to your lives
•  Mom practices a full flow with baby-in-arm
•  Learn about the postnatal body, common discomforts and how yoga can help
•  Infant massage and partner breathing are also a part of this practice
"What a child learns in the womb,
cannot be learned here on earth." ~Yogi Bajan~

LOCATIONS & CONTACT INFORMATION
Yoga Womb Registered Prenatal Yoga Teachers are based in various locations of Long Island from the Hampton Bays to Brooklyn. Please contact us to help us find a class near you!
For QUESTIONS about Prenatal Yoga to book a private session, a baby blessing or find a class 
contact Heather Simonson at
631-478-7301 ~ heather@secstalk.org ~ www.theyogawomb.com ~ Yoga Womb Pre/Postnatal Yoga Facebook Page

Prenatal Yoga Sundays 10:30 am 
Bearfoot Yoga 
6 4th Ave. 
Bay Shore, NY
results.name: Prenatal Yoga Long Island ~ The Yoga Womb

results.description: Yoga as a spiritual discipline fully supports dance, which is both a physical and spiritual manifestation of our humanity. When the yogi and dancer in us meet the interplay of their energies gives birth to a theater fueled not by their search for stardom, but by their quest for the betterment of humanity. The ultimate purpose of this yoga class is to prepare practitioners to develop a discipline and daily yoga practice in order to exercise introspection, build self-awareness and ultimately achieve growth. "Knowing love, I will allow all things to come and go, to be as supple as the wind and take everything that comes with great courage. Life is right in any case. My heart is as open as the sky." About Sylvie Bayeux Being a multifaceted woman Sylvie sees her self foremost as an Educator. She has been a religious yoga practitioner throughout her entire artistic career in theater and dance, developing her own personal practice based on Iyenger, Ashtanga and Multiversal schools of yoga. Teaching yoga to dancers, athletes and neophytes she helps them achieve strength, flexibility, and balance. Yet most importantly she guides them through a life-transforming experience, that of freeing their power within. Sylvie walks the path of yoga daily, as woman, dancer and artist, sharing her yoga knowledge through what she considers to be her dearest art form, the Art of Teaching.
results.name: Midtown East Yoga & Dance

results.description:
#CompassionConvos is a global compassion movement challenging bias through civic engagement and compassionate action. It's a call to action bringing people together to create individual and systemic change. We are a partner of The Charter for Compassion.

#CompassionConvos are cross-cultural and inter-generational conversations within communities and organizations around difficult and challenging subjects through social media, online and in person. Conversations include but aren't limited to racism, sexism, homophobia, and xenophobia. Through awareness, education, and dialogue we're challenged to take action. 

The goal of #CompassionConvos is to engage in dialogue within communities, organizations, corporations around difficult conversations and to encourage compassionate action.

I'm doing a ton of research and experimenting with different alternative treatments from diet changes to acupuncture and colonics. I've gone the medication route and found that it did not provide the support I thrive in the long term and live a full life -- without fear of the cycles coming back. I'd love to meet other conscious individuals on this or a similar journey so that we can share ideas and support one another.

Updated: I'm overwhelmed to see this community grow to 50+ in just two weeks and would love to learn more about where everyone is in their journey. If you are open to sharing, please do in the discussion section of our group.

results.description:
(It's very helpful to RSVP if you know you want to attend, as the space is only designed for about 15 people to comfortably participate.)

This group meets weekly to learn and practice meditation tools that stimulate clairvoyance. Emphasis is on exploring and enjoying clairvoyant psychic ability safely with practical benefit in a supportive environment. 

There is a loose curriculum built around the imparting of techniques and validation of subjective experience. A typical session may include  guided meditation and some clairvoyant readings and/or aura healings. The tools taught here emphasize creation of healthy psychic boundaries and self-care as much as ability.

We operate on the postulate that everyone is psychic. This space is NOT a place for experts & professional psychics to showcase abilities or solicit, etc. Professionals are welcome if they are here to learn more about caring for their own space and/or recovering from energies picked up during the course of work. Everyone is a beginner when it comes to addressing themselves as spirits in bodies in present time.

Class technically begins at 8:00 pm, though people can arrive from 7:30 onward. 

There is a $10 flexible suggested donation. It is intended that each person find their own valuation of BCL. Some people have taken multiple classes for free, some give $10. Some give $20 or more. Paypal is available as an option if cash is not convenient. Again, the space is NOT looking for experts or professionals to offer psychic services in exchange for free attendance.

results.description:
I decided to start this group because like most others I am a lover of all things beautiful. We all know the creative world is a beast and being alone in this world is just not the path you should take. Becoming a fashion designer is my ultimate career goal. 

However I do not come with an impressive, extensive formal fashion background, I did not attend Parson or the Elite Saint Martins. But I have a God given talent that exudes my entirety. It is the definition of who I am. The one thing that keeps me happy no matter my circumstances. It is the first thing I think about every morning and every night before I go to sleep. However I find myself standing alone in my passion, not being surrounded by a strong network of creative people who share similar interest. While I have been to many places and have met many influential people, still I find myself standing alone in my vision. Never truly making that connection. Therefore I find myself asking these questions without getting much of an answer… Most people will tell you, go to the Internet, ask Google! However as smart as Google maybe getting the facts or the support from someone who have truly stand or have walked in your shoe is priceless.

 Networking is a major contributor to success: Hence here I am, standing alone in my vision and now I invite you to stand with me in yours. Help me build a network of forward thinking, creative, informative but always fabulous, support system. Lets help each other achieve our goals little bit quicker. This group is only open to active, creative, driven individuals. All things beautiful include but not limited to: Fashion Designers, Interior Designers, Fashion Stylist, Hairstylist, Makeup Artist, Photographers, Bloggers, Writers, PR personals.
results.name: Creative Socials

results.description:
Disclaimer: David Hantman is the administrator and not an active member nor involved in recovery.  I am administering this site for Ellie Little who is involved in recovery.  This is her page.  I wish you all success on your journey.  


We are offering an alternative to AA for anyone who had difficulty with it or felt somehow evil and toxic because of it. And this is not simply for those struggling with substance abuse problems but I promise you are not alone.

That's why I created:
The giant leap! for the other 83%:
Did u know that AA and NA programs only help 17% of addicts for whom alcohol is not their main drug of choice? I tried it and frankly it seemed like the more I tried to serve their god the more it felt like I was the butt of the big guy's joke. That is why I have made this giant leap for the other 83% of mankind who were made to feel somehow defective because of AA
1 acknowledge that u r not powerless I mean u dragged ur ass to this meeting right? U r trying to take control of ur life so commend urself for that
2 write down every craving u have and I guarantee u will find them to be fewer and further between. Also write down everything u have tried in the past to get sober and everything u will do differently. Notice how much prouder u already feel 
3 if step two is hard because the last thing u wanna do when u have a craving is sit and stew in it, reach out for help. Real friends will be happy to help
4 try and remember a time when u knew urself and imagine urself at that age and what pure joys made u happy. Whatever it may be I guarantee u will involuntarily smile
5 through the reflection and meditation of step four u should be capable of finding the strength and power within urself: the strength that brought ur ass to this meeting and will hopefully prepare u for the next step
6 it is true that u will have to make amends to someone I mean lets be real but u may not always get the response u want so for every apology u make remind urself of something good u have done too even if that good thing is simply getting sober!
7 this one is a little tricky granted but will definitely help: think back to when u were a child and try to remember anything u were obsessed with whether it was a boy girl food or the idea of being popular. If u realize that the disease effected u before u encountered the drug then the next step will not be easy
8 by this point things in ur life that were once easy have now become incredibly hard, if they weren't then u would not be an addict. So while the main person u should be doing this for is u there are I'm sure other people in ur life or whom u would like back in ur life that u wish to be stronger for. Just think about them
9 confront those people and tell them U want to help them but u may need their help too. If u don't get the response u want remember step6 but the positive feedback is certain to keep u going at least for a while
10 by now the pressure of everyone accepting u again is building and you want to trip over ur own foot so u have no one else to blame. At this point return to steps 1,3&4 even simultaneously. Remember that power inside urself? It may feel dim but it cannot be snuffed out. After all ur still alive right? 
I'll admit I cannot promise that this alone will make me happy but I can tell u it gave me the hope of a happy future. My name is Ellie. And I am an addict

results.description: This group is for ladies who own friendly, well socialized smaller dogs. Dogs should be under 30 pounds and they should always be friendly to people and to other dogs. This is not a group to work out a dog's aggression or reactivity issues. Please make sure your dog is always leashed (no extension leashes) and that he or she is up to date on vaccinations. Treats are recommended to reward good behavior. We'll meet for walks in the park and around the Cranford and Westfield area. I'm working on positive reinforcement training to get my dog to walk nicely on a leash with other distractions and to be calm around other dogs. Please don't allow your dog to meet other dogs without the owner's permission because the owner may be working on training proper dog greetings. We'll also meet at dog friendly outdoor eateries to positively reinforce dogs for sitting calmly while we're having coffee or eating. Participants will be asked to sign a liability waiver at the start of meetups.

results.description: This Group is for people who always wanted to learn how to dance salsa but didn't know where to begin. We offer affordable classes that are cycle-based. The cycles run for 12 weeks and each week's material is based on a syllabus. Each class teaches you the next logical step in the learning process and we practice it thoroughly and review it the next week. That way, even if you missed one class, you will be able to catch up. Unlike other places, we do not charge you ahead of time. That is, you pay as you go. If you take 1 class, you pay for that class, period. this way, you do not have to pay if you missed one class. Our classes are affordable and offer a longer duration for the price. We teach Salsa on2, New York Style, which is what is danced in New York city and other places. So come out and finally learn how to dance salsa. It is great exercise, stress-relieving, educational, and incredibly fun.
results.name: Salsa Classes for Absolute Beginners

results.description:
Are you a Cougar? Do you do booty calls? Do you have a friend with benefits situation you are considering? Well, let me tell you about this awesome group!

This group is for singles (especially women) who have woken up from the Disney fantasy you have been sold and are looking for more logical, sensible and fun relationships. Marriage is great and all but finding a life partner is no small task and you are NOT getting any younger. Maybe you have given up or maybe you still looking but in the meantime, you have a desire for some kind of physical intimacy. You can find somebody in this group or use this group as a support network to help you find somebody. Let's also share ideas and talk about ways to make non-traditional relationships work. How do you avoid getting hurt? How can you be safe? What about dealing with societal issues like women being shamed for having casual relationship? Is there a wrong way and right way to make it work? Let's meet up and do something fun as we talk about things in a safe environment where you don't have to worry about being judged.

Although all daters are welcome, this group is more for confident daters who probably could do well with traditional dating if they so chose, but that is not their goal. The daters in this group should ideally not have problems attracting "good people" to date, it's just it's more about not finding what THEY want. Like with myself, if I just wanted a traditional girlfriend, I'd have no problem. The problem comes only with finding a woman who I actually want that with. The non-traditional dating options come in with what I do in the meanwhile until I find what I want for the long term.

So ultimately this group is not really about attracting a partner but rather figuring out how to make non-traditional dating options work. It's about once you already find the partner you seek, how does it all work? We are open to discussing all kinds of options from non-sexual type relationships, OGBC, FWB, XWSEX,  Cougar or whatever works for YOU, with the one exception of cheating. If that is your thing, that is on you, but this group cannot support you with that.
results.name: Hasbrouck Heights to hell with tradional Dating Meetup

results.description:
As educators, we believe each student has a unique learning ability, yet we continue to use the same teaching methods for all of them, hiding behind excuses such as crowded classrooms, not being able to detect each student’s learning character, lack of resources, etc. Today, we are in an age where we can get rid of many of our excuses and start creating learning experiences that will align with different students’ learning characteristics. Recently, with improvements in hi-tech tools in cognitive neuroscience, such as EEG and fMRI devices, we can see brain activity better and more clearly than ever before. In addition, with affordable technologies such as tablets, smartphones, Google Glass, etc., we can design more individualized learning media.

Determining how each student learns based on cognitive neuroscience and designing digital media for learning based on educational theories will lead to success in more students’ learning. Current teaching methods are only targeting a specific group of students; however, we need more individualized learning. We are losing many talents along the way due to our poor understanding of how people learn and our inability to adjust instruction to meet each student’s particular need. 

This group aims to contribute to the study of mind, brain, technology and education to identify individual differences among students, create learning design principles for designing more individualized digital learning media and techniques to improve students’ learning capacity. We believe the social environment affects learning as much as genetics, and we believe each student has their limitations and strengths. It is our mission to encourage students to take advantage of their strengths and to work with them to improve their limitations. 

This group welcomes Cognitive Neuroscientists, Technologists, Educators and any person who is interested in using cognitive neuroscience to improve digital media design for learning.
results.name: Mind, Brain, Technology and Education

results.description: Come join a diverse group of people for interactive workshops which focus on building your own leadership voice. The Maplewood Leadership Development Initiative is a series of individual learning events focused on leadership topics that are relevant to both work and personal life. Each leadership development event features a guest speaker with a deep level of expertise on a relevant topic, along with facilitated dialogue and exercises that help participants to apply knowledge to life and work. OPERATING PRINCIPLES 1. We seek to Democratize Leadership Development We believe great development opportunities should be available to anyone, anywhere. The cost however, in both time and money, can be prohibitive for many people to participate. This is especially true for individuals on a limited budget, small business owners, individual realtors and consultants, government officials, and those engaged in non-profit organizations. For people in for-profit business organizations, our offerings will complement your in- house training at a very competitive fee. To help democratize leadership development, our fees will always be reasonable, and based on the presenter's fee and costs for each event. Plus, we will allow you to self- select lower fees, if needed. We even offer a fee where you can choose to attend in exchange for performing a good deed. It will be that easy to afford! 2. Knowledge is an expense, while Applied Knowledge is development and an investment. As an example, take the simple transaction of purchasing a self-help or business book, ideally at your local bookstore. You finish reading the book, but you do not find any content meaningful to you and, as a result, you do not apply any of the content. We would suggest the purchase of this book is an expense. In another instance, you purchase and complete a different self-help or business book, you find the content relevant and, as a result, apply the content and it improves an aspect of your life/work. This purchase can be characterized as an investment, as you received a return on your investment of the cost of this book. follow up with coaching or peer group meetings. 3. We will always do our Good Deed! In the spirit of creating meaningful change in the world, The Maplewood Leadership Development Initiative will donate the net proceeds of each learning event to designated organizations that have a clear purpose of positively contributing to their community.
results.name: Maplewood Leadership Development Initiative

results.description:
'Belly-Boomba' Belly Dance is an aerobic style of dance fitness that is similar to ZUMBA but focuses mainly on BellyDance moves rather than Latin ones!

The purpose of this group is to encourage others, to gain strength, endurance, and fitness while learning  some of the basic fundamental movements of BellyDance. 

After gaining quite a bit of weight and an increased amount of stress, after I stopped teaching dance,  I realized it would be beneficial to try and lose the weight (UGGGhhh) and get back into shape while helping other ladies and gals of all shapes, ages, and sizes do the same, in a safe supportive, no judgement zone atmosphere, all while swaying to the sultry music of the middle east and meeting nice like minded ladies.

I tried Zumba for a while, but  and realized it would be more natural for me to teach 'Belly-Boomba' instead, with my background in BellyDance and as the soft and circular or undulating movements involved in this ancient feminine dance form are fairly natural to a woman's body at all stages of life, unlike dance forms such as ballet that require learning movements that are much more strenuous and forced.  In fact some historians believe that original purpose of many of the basic movements involved in the dance like undulations and hip circles involving the hips and abdomen including the 'Core" we all love to talk about, are believed to have been used or taught in ancient times in order to help ease the pains of childbirth.

The other purpose of the group is to have at least one or two monthly meetings where we not only burn some calories and strengthen our cores, but equally as important, we release all our cares and woes for a while and de-stress completely.   I'm counting on this being the push I need to get back into jeans and out of these damn yoga pants! lol

Ladies of all ages, shapes, and sizes encouraged to attend as it truly is an ancient dance form for modern women that celebrates the feminine divine in all of us :)




Other reasons for this meetup:   All work and no play makes Jill a dull girl.

Working girls, stay at home moms, goddesses of all types all need to step out and connect with other women 

in safe fun creative environments.   

Hoping to create a community of like minded ladies with a positive tone.

Apart from being respectful to each other, there is only one rule for this group: if you sign up for an event but can't make it, please change your event status. If you don't, you will have a No-Show record. After having 3 No-Shows, you will loose your membership to this group. This is because some events will have limited spots, so by holding the spot, other people who can make it otherwise will not be able to. In addition, without knowing you are not coming, the group will wait for you, which is inconvenient. On a related note, if you are late, please also let the event-organizer know.

Lastly, since I'm paying membership fees of 19 dollars month by month to host this group, each meet-up event will be charged for 1 dollar and you can pay when you come to the event. The remaining funds will be used for our end-of-year Christmas party.

results.description:
Are you an expectant mom? Or recently had a little bundle of Joy? And do you live in the Cranford-area (Cranford, Westfield, Clark, Scott Plains, Summit, Springfield, Short Hills, etc)? If so - this might be the group for you!

There does not seem to be many groups like this around (most have already transitioned from pregnancy to post-baby already), so let's see if there is interest in the area.  Ideas for this group (easy events to bond/chat/vent/etc. about pregnancy and beyond) include: walks/picnics in the park (hooray for Spring on its way!), coffee, brunch, lunch, pregnancy/parenting classes, etc. Open to suggestions. Thanks!

Best,
Organizer - Stephanie (due July 8th)

P.S.  I run another group on Meetup (Girlfriends Near Millburn/Cranford late 20's-30's) and have found that laying out some 'governance' is key to a successful group.  So here goes:

1. We'll always keep this group small (under 50 members is ideal)

2. This group will consist of the most active members - therefore members who are inactive for months at a time will be removed  (while understanding that some time off before/after the birth of your baby is necessary!)

3. This group will follow proper etiquette - please do not be a 'no show' (let us know if something comes up!) or cancel too often at the last minute (especially if we have reservations/a wait-list for an event), etc.  Understanding that life is (or is about to be) super hectic, just reach out and keep us in the loop of what's going on!

Following these 'rules' will help vet the most active members and allow us to build meaningful friendships and a support system as we all aim to figure this mommy-thing out!  ;)

Thanks ladies - looking forward to meeting you soon!

results.description: The Fertile Ground Live Connected Series: 4 classes / 4 phases of the moon. Each phase of the moon we dive deep into the archetypical energies associated with that particular phase. These teachings give us tools and wisdom to integrate into our modern day lives. This is a lively experiential class, filled with discussion, movement, rituals, deep contemplation and self care practices. We gain a deeper understanding into our own lives, cycles and rhythms. Women have always gathered together in community to understand themselves and each other more fully. We all get to see our selves in one another. We offer a safe container for women to find their voice and be heard. New Moon Ceremonies: We celebrate the New Moon to mark a cycle in time with honor and reverence to whatever we are sitting with or chewing on in our lives. The New Moon is an auspicious time of the cycle for setting intentions, connecting deep in desires and to re-assess with loving wisdom where you get to let go. These monthly Fertile Ground ceremonies are connecting women with each other and with themselves. Through, meditation, movement practices and ritual, we have an opportunity to tap into our inner voice and essence.

results.description: Become a vessel for healing! In this powerful and comprehensive professional two-day training, you will receive everything you need to become a confident and successful Shamanic Reiki I practioner. You will learn to harness this powerful healing energy and channel it to yourself and others. Becoming a Reiki practioner opens energy channels in the body and the spirit. This can lead to deep and profound changes in your quality of life, sense of self, and your ability to manifest. Not to mention giving yourself a holistic way to work with your own physical challenges. Even after a Reiki I training, students often experience a heightened sense of intuition and even psychic sense. Life direction can become clearer, as well as a heightened ability to hold love in a deeper way. Reiki teaches us to align with our innate compassion and goodness, and opens us to new possibilities. Finally, in Reiki, the ‘healer is made’. We are all healers, and Reiki is said to lie dormant in our DNA, waiting for us to excavate it and use it for the benefit of others and the world. The following will be covered in this SHAMANIC REIKI I class: - Historical background of Traditional Usui Reiki - In depth definition of what Reiki is and what it can do - Shamanic journeying for healing - The hand positions to treat self and others - Working with plants and stones - Energetic extraction and Soul Healing - The Reiki I Attunement Ceremony - The alchemy of healing - Reiki ethics - Using Reiki to cure specific conditions (physical and emotional) - Using Reiki to empower your goals - The energy body (the Aura)and the Chakras - You will learn to do administer a full Reiki treatment - A detailed reiki manual - A certificate of completion - Lots of love and personal attention REIKI, as defined by the International Center for Reiki Training Reiki is a Japanese technique for stress reduction and relaxation that also promotes healing. It is administered by the “laying on of hands” and is based on the idea that an unseen “life force energy” flows through us and is what causes us to be alive. The word Reiki is made of two Japanese words - Rei which means “God’s Wisdom or the Higher Power” and Ki which is “life force energy.” So Reiki is actually “spiritually guided life force energy.” In a Reiki class, one receives a Reiki ‘attunement’ — the Reiki Master facilitates a transference of universal life force energy to the student. The student is then able to work with Reiki energy at will. Saturday & Sunday April 16-17, 2016 9:00am-12:30pm & 2:00pm-5:00pm Yoga Vida 666 Broadway at Bond Investment: $275
results.name: SHAMANIC REIKI 1 TRAINING IN NYC

results.description:
Thank you for taking the time to see what the Whitestone Walking Warriors are all about. We are excited to announce that we have scheduled our Kick-Off Meeting for April 11th from 10am-12pm; you may already RSVP if you are planning on attending. We will then have our first 2-3 mile walk as a group at Little Bay Park on April 18th at 10am. Our spring schedule is complete and we will be adding meet ups to our group calendar shortly.

Now for a little background on your group organizers, Larissa and Debra. We are Personal Wellness Coaches as well as Independent Product Distributors for Herbalife. Our goal, up until now, was to simply reach as many people as we could (between our full time Mommy positions) and assist our clients on their personal journeys; health, fitness and nutrition were the focal points of our coaching. While this is still something we love to do, we have learned a few things along the way of our own journeys.

Social/Group Walking has been proven to work on many levels. The one that stood out most for us was the community aspect. The fields of fitness and nutrition need a community of like minded people to be there to support one another. When you set out to make a lifestyle change, you need a cheering section and someone to help you up when you stumble. Change can be scary, so having others to offer their experiences, knowledge and accomplishments is a great way to keep your confidence and momentum going. While some are able to achieve success without a community standing behind them, difficulties may emerge, weight will be put back on, meal planning and prepping will no longer be enjoyable, and suddenly, many find themselves right back where they started.

We are hoping for a large variety of excited participants from different backgrounds, decades, generations and cultures. The individuals that we believe will benefit most from our vision are simply those who believe in the benefits of exercising with a group. Walking, in particular, is a low impact form of exercise that mostly everyone can do on a regular basis. We are not looking to conduct high intensity classes, or incorporate weights and other fitness apparatus that would make it difficult to focus on our main objectives of fitness and socialization. Members, you are invited to bring your children, strollers, and babies. Pet parents, your dogs are also welcomed. We see each and every one of you as a valuable member of our growing community and we will not place restrictions on members when at all possible.

It is important to us that our members understand that we are a social walking group and our visions and goals are geared towards creating a community based on the common interest of leading healthier, more active lifestyles. While we may incorporate Herbalife into some of our Meet ups, our main objective is to create our community of Whitestone Walking Warriors and make it something we can all be proud of. Members will never be required to take part in Herbalife in order to continue with our Meet ups. Herbalife taught us one of the most valuable lessons in the health and fitness field: a community is essential. A strong, active, committed community knows no bounds when it comes to supporting one another on their personal wellness journeys.

We are really looking forward to putting our plan into action! Check back regularly and feel free to contact us on anything!

<br>
results.name: Whitestone Social Walking Group: Health. Fitness. Nutrition

results.description: We're all grappling with our emotions. Humans experience emotions from grief and regret to desire and doubt. They're hard to understand. We seldom have an opportunity to have a open dialogue about these emotional states with others, and talk about each one–how they work and how they affect us. These meet-ups are an opportunity to pause and contemplate on our emotional states. Let's work do develop our emotional wisdom. This is a group for anyone interested in sitting down with others and having a focused conversation on a particular emotional topic. The group and discussions are gently facilitated by a design consultancy specializing in social and emotional well-being, mattermindstudio.com. *This group nor the conversations are facilitated by licensed mental health professionals.
results.name: Round Table: Emotional States

results.description:
As we all know, there was a time in the past when there was "Book Burning".  Books that were deemed offensive were burned in ritual destruction usually carried out in a public context.  This form of censorship usually proceeds from a cultural, religious, or political opposition to the materials in question.

When I was in high school and the teacher told us we had to read The Catcher in the Rye, we thought it was just another book.  When he told us that "they use to burn this book" we all wanted to read it.  Any book that people use to burn is a book we wanted to read.

So this group will be reading books that were once considered offensive and were burned.  We will also read books that will be burned in the future if Trump becomes president and orders that certain books to be burned.
results.name: Burning Book Meetup

results.description:
Brought to you by The Ruckus Podcast:

Rucking is the sport of walking long distances with a weighted bag, or ruck sack. This is usually completed as a group, with an emphasis on teamwork. Interspersed are bouts of physical training to produce the strongest warriors, in mind and body. Distances range from 2.5 to 5.0 miles, between 75 to 90 minutes.

No fees. Never going to cost you a thing to participate. Donations to a respectable nonprofit for veterans is always welcome though. (List of good NP's to come soon!)

Who can participate? Anyone! Beginner walkers to ultra endurance athletes. Rucking is a great social activity for everyone. Please remember to bring water and a comfortable backpack with at least 20 lbs. The weight can be old textbooks, bricks, a dumbbell, or even a weight plate. Be creative.

To learn more about rucking, visit http://www.goruck.com/rucking
results.name: East Brunswick Ruck Club

Why join this group? -You can make new friends and have fun with other Soca and Carnival lovers -Dress up in vibrant costumes in carnival events throughout the year -Bond with other Caribbean/NonCaribbean women who love playing mas -Participate in meetups prior to the carnival events *PLEASE READ* NY Girls Who Dance in Caribbean Carnivals *20 to Mid 30s* Rules *If you are inactive member who barely participates in any of the group meetups, you will be booted from the group. *If you can't attend an event after you RSVP, please let the group organizer know in advance. *Any member who joins under a fake profile and name will get booted from the group to protect the safety of members *Violence, illegal activity, and inappropriate behaviours are neither welcome or tolerated in this group *We ask that you can try and make it to at least 2 or 3 meetups per year to be an active member *If you are not a women within the ages of 20 to Mid 30s please don't sign up

results.description:
How does one know when a dame is a “great dame”? I say, there are three kinds of dames: the Royal Dame, the Grande Dame and the "there is nothing like a" Great Dame. We'll be focusing on the last kind. 

We’ve all met some great dames in our lives. Hell, we might already BE one!

A Great Dame tends to have smarts, a story and an opinion. A whole lot of them, most likely. She’s not so easily shocked and can take a joke and loves to laugh.  A Great Dame may not be as confident as she looks but she’ll fake it whenever necessary.

Great Dames is a group of women over 50 who are not cowed by their age, in fact, they FLAUNT it! They enjoy the company of other women, they love to laugh so hard they pee and are willing to take a big bite out of life. They are IN or READY FOR their second or third act. This all came about because of a play I wrote, produce and act in called Dames Like Us! 

It's an ensemble monologue play that goes straight for the funny in its mission to politely demolish long-held stereotypes of women "of a certain age". The seven fabulous New York actresses who are part of my rotating cast are amazingly talented, a lot of fun and they like sharing their gifts.

And so, coming soon, we'll all be putting our heads together to come up with fun stuff to do in the city with you as well as series of workshops that will stimulate your creativity and imagination.

Being a Great Dame isn't just a Meetup Group - it's a REVOLUTION!

                                                       Welcome, Francesca
results.name: Great Dames

results.description:
This group aims to help people who struggle with taking action, decision making, managing stress, balancing work and family, and who are in the general pursuit of happiness. It's for people who are tired of talking about their problems, and would like to learn skill-building exercises to manage and support positive emotions. Only when our emotions support our resulting thoughts, can thoughts be transformed into action. Otherwise, it's an uphill battle, with us trying to force ourselves into thinking or being a certain way.

This group is to help people get on solid emotional footing through mindful emotions management. You will learn about the power of observation vs. being a part of the negativity of your mind. This separation helps us acknowledge that there is a problem to solve, without being sucked into becoming part of the problem.

Examples of practical application in one's own life include managing reactions to stress, managing the impact of our emotions on our lives personally and professionally, tempering our responses to rejection and interpersonal conflict, and pursuing true happiness.

There will be free as well as paid events in this group. It will say which with each meetup that is scheduled.
results.name: The Masterful You Self-Help Through Mindfulness Group

results.description:
This group is an invitation to come together to meditate. New to meditation, experienced or in between, everybody is welcome to the group. Chopra's meditation method is very simple and easy to understand.

I give the basic instructions and we practice silent meditation for about 20 minutes. We reinforce the practice with a centering thought from Chopra's teachings.  We also suggest daily mindful activities so that with practice they become habits of a healthy and focused mind.  Meditation is the basic tool for a more wholesome relaxed life and when it is paired with mindful action it becomes the key that unlocks your connection to your intrinsic nature that is whole, creative and happy.

results.description:
Why do we exist? 

~ Working, church, family time, and school leaves us with no time to make friends with good, genuine people outside of our mundane kind of life. This is a come as you are, be accepted as the person you are and not what society labels you as group. This will be a safe haven for you feel that you can come as you are wherever you’re at in life. 

Who’s welcome… 

~ Women (ages 22-35) interested in learning about our faith in God or interested in sharing in the personal journey of spiritual growth through our study of scripture and social gatherings. What will you get out of this group? What you put into it. We hope this group provides an opportunity to create and cultivate… 

~ life long friendships 

~ celebrations of life occasions (because it’s the little things) 

~ personal growth - genuine support and sense of community 

So wherever you are in life, we want this group to encourage women to be authentic in their walk with God and the issues that we face throughout life. God has given us the gift of friendship and our hope is that this group will provide the opportunity for us to develop meaningful connections through the study of the Word by leaning on God’s promises as well as each other.

results.description:
Hello, I'm Alex and I love poker and the community surrounding it. I started playing over ten years ago. I started my very own first home game years ago and it attracted a lot of players, friends and friends of friends and even random people eventually. I am looking to start running some friendly games again sometime in the future and I thought i'll start here to gather some network of players and build a community. Games will be available whenever I can get enough players at any given time of any given day. So far, most of the network consists of Asians (some that are still learning the game lol) so it will be big ++ if you can speak some chinese or don't mind other players speaking that (off course will be kept minimum and monitored to prevent any form of unfairness). Games will consist mostly of 1/2 or 2/5 no limit holdem games, nothing too big but who knows, might even get some other games in! 

Lets built a nice local community and maybe we can even get to know each other better and do some ac trips in the future :) If you are a poker player or interested and within the Brooklyn area, you should join. If you are also Asian, that would be perfect but not necessary as I have non Asian players too already in my network.

Some things you can expect in my games are players of all sorts of skill levels and play styles. An actual authentic poker table, high quality playing cards, custom chips, professional dealers, television, snacks, beverages ++ more. The game is very competitive, but everyone is friendly and looking to have a good time. A great game in a relaxing, air conditioned, and competitive environment. Fully secure and video monitored. Only players who are screened will be allowed to play for everyone's sake of safety. We start at random times and end whenever until game breaks.

In MATCH GAME NYC audience members (that's you) form teams to match a series of “fill in the blank” questions with our witty celebrity panelists. The most matches by the top two teams win cool stuff! 

Match Game NYC is a fun free-for-all (or FREE fun-for-all) perfect for groups, icebreakers, first dates, parleys, and of course Meetups! 

Why is Match Game not your average bar night out with friends? Because in MATCH GAME NYC everyone can play or dive right in, there’s zero downtime, and there are no wrong answers... only one perfect match! 

So upgrade your bar night and break free of the bingo/trivia blues! And be sure to join us every 1st Thursday at Sidewalk for all the [BLANKS] you can handle!

results.description:
Welcome! Big Data Ingesters,

This meetup has been formed to discuss customer use cases and design patterns for big data ingestion, transformation, and egression. Use cases for transformations include fast real-time analytics, data movement, disastor recovery in Hadoop, data integration, fast batch, and database load/off-load. Key focus will be on integrating Hadoop with various systems including Message Systems, File Systems, and Databases. Users should be able to connect to any source and any destination from within Hadoop. Ability to leverage any user code as part of the connections and transformations. We expect to develop a strong community that has a deep influence on big data ecosystem.

Examples of Messaging Systems include ActiveMQ, Flume, JMS, Kafka, Kinesis Streams, MapR Streams, Nifi, RabbitMQ, Solace, ZeroMQ, etc.

Examples of File Systems include HDFS, FTP, NFS, S3, SFTP, MapR-FS etc.

Examples of Databases/Stores include Accumulo, AeroSpike, Cassandra, CouchDb, MongoDB, HBase, Couchbase, Geode, HBase, Hive Tables, MapR-DB, Impala, JDBC, HP Vertica, MemCache, MemSql, MySql, Oracle, Redis, etc.

Examples of protocols include AMPQ, HTTP, MQTT, SMTP, Rest/Soap, Twitter, Websockets, etc.

Other connectors include ElasticSearch, Splunk, Solr etc.

Our events will include production customer who will present their use cases.
results.name: Big Data (native Hadoop) Ingest and Transform, New York

results.description: The CUNY Fatherhood Academy, is a comprehensive program designed to promote responsible parenting and economic stability for unemployed and underemployed young fathers through education, employment, and personal development. Increasing familial engagement, attaining a High School Equivalency (HSE) diploma or wants to attend college, and acquiring gainful employment are all essential goals for the participants enrolled in the CFA. The program’s central focus is to help young fathers prepare for and enroll into college with the understanding that earning a college degree is the most effective path toward providing long-term economic sustainability for themselves and their families. HSE TASC (GED) Track At CFA participants will receive, for FREE: • Preparation for the TASC, NY’s high school equivalency exam or CUNY Skills Assessment Test • Career and educational exploration. • Preparation for college enrollment and job placement. • Work experience through internships and/or part-time jobs. • Workshops on important parenthood topics including familial bonding, health, and financial literacy. • Metrocards, incentives, food coupons and more. COLLEGE Track • CUNY Entrance Exam Prep • Internship Placement • Employment Readiness & Career Exploration • Employment Placement • Men’s & Parenting Workshops • College Enrollment & Financial Aid assistance • Metrocards, incentives food coupons and more. To be eligible they must be: • Male between the ages of 18 and 24 years • Eligible to work in the United States (citizen, have a green card, or have a work visa) • Not enrolled in college or another training program. • Have a child or be expecting a baby.

results.description:
WELCOME TO RAINBOW TRAVELERS NETWORK!

This group is for ALL members of the LGBT community (and their allies) who love to travel! Tired of being limited to men/women-only cruises or pride events as a way to explore the world with gay friends, family or significant others? Want to meet others from our community with the same wanderlust?...then the Rainbow Travelers Network is for you! 

Our intension is to bring together all those under the rainbow who want more than a cruisy cruise or an all-inclusive on an island (although that's definitely fun too)....and want to really experience culture, food, history, art, music, people, language and all the wonders that each destination truly offers. We have worked tirelessly to accrue reputable suppliers, many who are affiliated with the IGLTA (International Gay and Lesbian Travel association) and are proud to provide services to the LGBT community. 

Through small intimate groups aimed at 12-15 people - we plan to provide authentic, intimate experiences so you can truly enjoy the trip and get to know your fellow travelers. As interest grows for certain itineraries, there is a potential for groups to become larger. Because we truly want to be all-encompassing, there will be a mix of itineraries with destinations both domestic and international, various accommodation levels and price point, active and leisure itineraries, etc. Also, some trips will be joining larger groups and some will be private tours just for us.  Although our main objective is to create itineraries for a mixed group of member, there will be occasional trips that will have a specific demographic focus (i.e. men or women only).

Stay tuned for upcoming meetups where we can discuss current trips and ideas for the future. 

Look forward to hearing from you and hope you join us one one of our up coming trips!....LET'S SEE THE WORLD TOGETHER! 

Please contact us with any questions.

Best regards,

Aurelio
results.name: Rainbow Travelers Network

results.description:
Does The Hyperledger Project have the potential to become the engine behind most successful decentralized applications and organizations created in the next 25-50 years? Absolutely!

A much better question is how, and in what new ways, can we:

a) Build decentralized applications, organizations and APIs at 10x the speed at 1/10 the cost.

b) Build situational awareness in the local community.

I believe that the convergence of decentralized applications, decentralized organizations, artificial intelligence and IoT brings upon us the Great Displacement of the 21st century, where the majority of workforce will be left without “conventional” jobs, forced to learn new skills and professions.

Why?

Founders of this group believe that the Hyperledger Foundation will be the engine behind decentralization of the world, a massive economic change of the next 25-50 years.

So.... why don't we standardize and democratize the field with and around Hyperledger?

What?

We are a local micro community of those interested in advancing their knowledge of Hyperledger, its use cases and applications.

How?

Join our group for a regular dose of human interaction, conversations, smiles, food and drinks on all things Hyperledger:

• Use Cases

• Competitive analysis of Hyperledger startups (Distributed Apps from disruptive companies in specific vertical markets)

• How-To’s

• Interviews with individuals working at the edge of the Hyperledger project

• Reviews of tools, services and APIs offered by the Hyperledger ecosystem

• Best Practices in Application Architecture

• Do’s and Don’ts

• Application Templates

• Hackathons

• Security in the decentralized world - on the edge, on the node, in the cloud and in transit

• How others solve some of the hard problems that exist in the world using Hyperledger.

https://www.hyperledger.org

https://github.com/hyperledger

Join the movement. Let’s change the world. Because with Hyperledger we can.
results.name: Hyperledger (NYC Chapter)

results.description:
We all are fellow travelers on the road in search for home~ a place where you can be comfortable and just be yourself. A long journey full of adventures is awaiting for us to explore and a silent whispering awakens our dormant spirits, "Do not fear but believe". 

New York Village welcomes people coming from all over the world speaking different languages and sharing their cultures. Just like a rainbow that blends different colors into one beautiful mix of styles and sounds.

1. WHAT HOBBIES DO YOU ENJOY DOING OR WHAT IS YOUR AREA OF EXPERTISE THAT YOU'D LIKE TO SHARE WITH OTHERS?: All you have to do is ask us to organize an activity of your preference and we'll invite other members to join you!

Here are some of our suggestions~

- Language Sessions: Conversation sessions, 24x7 Group Chat rooms in Kakaotalk (Korean, Spanish, English and French), etc. 

- Cultural Experiences: Getting a Full-body Scrubbing Massage at Jjimjilbang(Korean style sauna), Recording your own favorite Songs at Noraebang, Food Tasting tours in Traditional Markets, etc.

- Fun Events: Going to International Restaurants for EXOTIC Cuisines, Group Visits to interesting Festivals and Touristic places, Girl's Chat Nights, Salsa Dance sessions, International Movie Nights, etc. 

- Outdoor activities: Walking Tours, Group Hiking, Bike Riding and Yoga at the Park, etc. 

- Sharing Your Knowledge and Skills: Introducing your Home Country to others, Leading Conversation sessions in your Favorite Language, Teaching others How to Cook and Bake, etc.

2. IF YOU HAVE RECENTLY ARRIVED TO NEW YORK, WOULD YOU LIKE US TO INTRODUCE YOU SOMEONE WHO CAN HELP YOU GET FAMILIAR WITH THE LOCAL CULTURE?: We'll help you find new friends who can share their experiences of having lived in New York. 

Hopefully, you'll find these activities helpful for integrating yourself better with the local culture and community. We do our best with the few resources we have but the idea is to take small steps forward into making New York a little bit more friendly for all our friends coming from the different corners of the world.

Welcome to New York~
results.name: New York Village
